Home → New suggestions → Young adult → Page → Young Adult

Young Adult

Reviews, recommendations, posts and ideas for and by young adults.

I Was Born for This by Alice Oseman

Written by Amy Rush Da Silva · Published Jun 12, 2018

I Was Born For This is a beautifully written, very character-driven book that takes you on a very unexpected journey.

Bad Girls with Perfect Faces by Lynn Weingarten

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Jun 7, 2018

Bad Girls With Perfect Faces is twisted, rather alarming, and well worth a read.

Flying Tips for Flightless Birds by Kelly McCaughrain

Written by Emma Maguire · Published Jun 5, 2018

Flying Tips for Flightless Birds is a story about friendship, first love in all its forms, trust and family relationships.

Warcross by Marie Lu

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published May 31, 2018

Warcross is a fantastic book that is packed full of memorable characters and casual diversity.

New Young Adult books for June 2018

Written by Sophie Green · Published May 30, 2018

Fantasy and gritty realism, life-affirming yarns and suspenseful horror: this month's Young Adult list has something for everyone.

The Astonishing Colour of After by Emily X. R. Pan

Written by Amy Rush Da Silva · Published May 29, 2018

The Astonishing Colour of After is an incredible read that takes you on an emotional journey.

The Cruel Prince by Holly Black

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published May 24, 2018

The Cruel Prince is intriguing, atmospheric and really dark.

Landscape with Invisible Hand by M. T. Anderson

Written by Kate Ashton · Published May 22, 2018

Landscape with Invisible Hand will appeal to fans of retro science fiction.

I Am Thunder by Muhammad Khan

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published May 17, 2018

I Am Thunder is timely, diverse and has a powerful message.

Goodbye, Perfect, by Sara Barnard

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published May 10, 2018

Goodbye Perfect is a phenomenal dissection of female friendships, loyalty and family.

About our Young Adult section

Book reviews, reading suggestions and blog posts from our staff and young adult readers. Want to write for our website? Email us at help@suffolklibraries.co.uk.
